mapper.select: select b.url url,a.name name,a.code code from sys_permission a inner join sys_resource b on a.resource_id = b.id where url<>''

select sr.id, sr.parent_id, sr.level, sp.`name`,sp.`code`,sr.url from sys_permission sp inner join sys_role_permission srp on sp.id = srp.permission_id inner join sys_user_role sur on srp.role_id = sur.role_id inner join sys_user su on su.id = sur.user_id and su.login_user = #{loginUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR} inner join sys_resource sr on sp.resource_id = sr.id

select sr.name,spion.`code` url, sr.`level` level,sr.parent_id,sr.sort,spion.id as id from sys_permission as spion inner join sys_resource as sr on spion.resource_id = sr.id and sr.`status` = 0 and spion.`status` = 0 order by sr.parent_id asc ,sr.sort asc

select sr.name,spion.`code` url, sr.`level` level,sr.parent_id,sr.sort,spion.id as id from sys_permission as spion inner join sys_resource as sr on spion.resource_id = sr.id and sr.resource_type= #{resType,jdbcType=INTEGER} and spion.perm_type = #{resType,jdbcType=INTEGER} and sr.`status` = 0 and spion.`status` = 0 order by sr.parent_id asc ,sr.sort asc

select sr.name,sp.`code` url,sr.level level,sr.parent_id,sr.sort,sp.id as id from sys_permission sp inner join sys_role_permission srp on sp.id = srp.permission_id inner join sys_user_role sur on srp.role_id = sur.role_id inner join sys_user su on su.id = sur.user_id and su.login_user = #{loginUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR} and su.user_type = #{userType,jdbcType=INTEGER} inner join sys_resource sr on sp.resource_id = sr.id
